Writing in the years after Reconstruction as white supremacy took new virulent forms, Chesnutt addressed topics of vital concern, then and now, including race, identity, violence, class, and the familial and economic relations that zigzag across America’s color line.
Context: Small-scale project in which scholars worked individually or as small collectives.

Barebones project description: Uncover, highlight, and share the works of marginalized artists, predominately women writers of color living and working in North America.
Context: Small-scale project in which scholars worked individually or as small collectives.
Notes: The site is no longer able to accept submissions for new author pages, reviews/essays, or interviews.

Project Title: The Online Archive of Nineteenth-Century U.S. Women’s Writings
Barebones project description: The archive includes texts from eight women writers: Lydia Maria Child, Elizabeth Stuart Phelps, Harriet Prescott Spofford, Sarah Orne Jewett, Charlotte Perkins Gilman, Victoria Earle Matthews, Willa Cather, and Zitkala-Sa (Gertrude Bonnin).
Context: Small-scale project in which scholars worked individually or as small collectives.

Barebones project description: An online database of unedited, digitised works of women’s writing from the 17th through to the early 20th centuries.
Context: Project produced by e-text centers, digital humanities centers, or libraries and museums.

Barebones project description: An electronic archive of two communities in the American Civil War--Augusta County, Virginia, and Franklin County, Pennyslvania.

Project Title: Race and Place: An African-American Community in the Jim Crow South
Barebones project description: An archive about the racial segregation laws, or the 'Jim Crow' laws from the late 1880s until the mid-twentieth century.
Context: Project produced by e-text centers, digital humanities centers, or libraries and museums.

Barebones project description: One of the earliest humanities research portals. VoS began in 1994 as a 70+ Web-page directory of humanities research resources organized by field, historical period, author, etc.
Context: Provides a good measure of the huge number of early recovery projects focused on literature and history written by and about people of color

Project Title: 19: Interdisciplinary Studies in the Nineteenth Century
Barebones project description: A peer-reviewed journal dedicated to advancing interdisciplinary study in the long nineteenth century.
Context: A positive example of how we might take the institutional structures that have developed in relation to the digital humanities canon and leverage them to support small-scale projects.

Creators: Timothy Powell and the Ojibwe elders
Barebones project description: Preserving and revitalizing Anishinaabemowin ('the Anishinaabe language') and culture to empower future generations.
Context: A partnership that shifted ownership of cultural materials from that of the scholar to the Ojibwe elders, in effect creating a mechanism by which the tribe might control their own cultural materials.

Barebones project description: Gathers the cultural record of Concord, Massachusetts in an interactive digital archive that features multiple innovative user interfaces.
Context: How to appropriately apply technological standards to shifting constructions of race represented in textual materials.

Barebones project description: Challenges traditional ways that people learn about the past with its print, visual, and multimedia materials that explore the diverse social and cultural histories of the nation.
Context: How the intersection of humanistic inquiry and technological innovation can be harnessed to newly empower individuals or groups.

Barebones project description: An electronic archive of two communities in the American Civil War--Augusta County, Virginia, and Franklin County, Pennyslvania.
Context: Example of humanities computing as the realm of seasoned specialists whose search for deeper understanding of a particular field brought them to digital tools.

Barebones project description: Engage with curriculum innovation and the integration of new technologies in American Studies.
Context: How technology and the networks it enables can open up pedagogical processes to inquiry, intervention, and reinvention

Barebones project description: A collaborative scholarship of teaching and learning project exploring the impact of technology on learning, primarily in the humanities.
Context: How technology and the networks it enables can open up pedagogical processes to inquiry, intervention, and reinvention

Creators: Alan Lui, Christine Henseler, Geoffrey Rockwell, Stéfan Sinclair, Melissa Terras
Barebones project description: An advocacy initiative for the humanities focused on placing the value of the humanities before the public. We draw in particular on the expertise of the international digital humanities community.
Context: The stridency and grandiosity of the 4Humanities mission statement is important and necessary, but there does not seem to be a detailed plan at this stage for realizing the group’s goals.

Barebones project description: A digital research and educational platform for exploring, learning about, and interacting with the layered histories of city and global spaces.
Context: Projects like this, which embrace “perpetual beta” and focus more on delivering whiz-bang components than doing the less glamorous—and less recognized—work of outreach, community development, and support, especially around questions of pedagogy and curriculum development.

Barebones project description: A publishing platform available to any member of the University of Mary Washington community.
Context: Pushed the school’s curriculum to embrace the opportunities of networked teaching and learning and the exploration of processes of digital identity formation.

Project Title: A Living Laboratory: Revitalizing General Education for a 21st Century College of Technology
Institution: New York City College of Technology, CUNY
Barebones project description: Re-envision General Education as a “living laboratory” using City Tech’s signature strengths – hands-on experiential models of learning and our vibrant Brooklyn Waterfront location.
Grant supported?: U.S. Department of Education Developing Hispanic-Serving Institutions (Title V) program.
Context: Offers an exciting reconceptualization of the traditional general education curriculum.

Barebones project description: An open space where the CUNY community can find like-minded colleagues, build personal or professional websites, teach, learn, and collaborate in open classrooms.
Context: Example of how Matthew K. Gold has been an active participant in the digital humanities community.

Barebones project description: An effort to bring together students, staff, and faculty from all CUNY campuses interested in or involved with the digital humanities

Institution: New York City College of Technology (CUNY), New York University, University of Mary Washington, Rutgers University-Camden.
Barebones project description: A collaborative online space in which students research Whitman’s connections to their individual locations and share that research with one another in a dynamic, social, web-based learning environment.
Grant supported?: NEH, Institute of Museum and Library Services
Context: Explores both the structure and “place-based pedagogy”.

Chapter: Chapter 20: Graduate Education and the Ethics of the Digital Humanities
Author: Alexander Reid
Barebones project description: Provides students and scholars with access to all of Dante Gabriel Rossetti's pictorial and textual works and to a large contextual corpus of materials.
Context: Most of the scholarship undertaken is directed as traditional humanistic areas of study - the project is not itself a scholarly study of digital technology; it is research into Rossetti’s works.

Barebones project description: An open space where the CUNY community can find like-minded colleagues, build personal or professional websites, teach, learn, and collaborate in open classrooms.
Context: A platform for academic collaboration across institutions and across disciplines

Chapter: Chapter 21: Should Liberal Arts Campuses Do Digital Humanities? Process and Products in the Small College World
Author:
Bryan Alexander, 
Rebecca Frost Davis
Creators: Edward L. Ayers, Andrew Torget, Scott Nesbit
Barebones project description: A collection of thousands of historical “episodes” that paints a wide-ranging portrait of the past that is freely available to scholars, teachers, and the general public. Students from a variety of college and universities write these episodes.
Context: The Digital Scholarship Lab at the University of Richmond enjoys, perhaps, the highest level of institutional support, since noted digital humanist Ed Ayers is the president of the university.
Notes: Project exists but no longer updated.

Project Title: Landscapes of the American Past: Visualizing Emancipation
Barebones project description: A map of slavery’s end during the American Civil War. It finds patterns in the collapse of southern slavery, mapping the interactions between federal policies, armies in the field, and the actions of enslaved men and women on countless farms and city blocks. It encourages scholars, students, and the public to examine the wartime end of slavery in place, allowing a rigorously geographic perspective on emancipation in the United States.
Context: The Digital Scholarship Lab at the University of Richmond enjoys, perhaps, the highest level of institutional support, since noted digital humanist Ed Ayers is the president of the university.

Barebones project description: An interactive map, pinpointing where many famous Americans lived in Paris, and a timeline indicating when they were in residence.
Notes: Link not active http://tocqueville.richmond.edu/AmericansInParis.html

Creators: Michael Drout, Scott Kleinman, Mark LeBlanc
Barebones project description: As part of its research program, the Lexomics group develops the Lexos text analysis tool, which implements aspects of our research methods. The role of Lexos is to help readers of literature identify and explore patterns in texts, thereby opening up new questions and new avenues of research.
Context: Interdisciplinary - combines computer science, statistics, and Old English texts.

Barebones project description: Students majoring in non-science disciplines often have little exposure to computational thinking and working with computer code.  At the same time, digital methods of analysis exert growing influence on the practice of many disciplines in the humanities and social sciences.  The Wheaton College Digital History Project seeks to bridge this gap using tools from the field of digital humanities.
Context: Major funding entities see the unbundled model as a viable alternative to digital humanities centers
Notes: Citation is a broken link.

Barebones project description: THATCamp stands for “The Humanities and Technology Camp.” It is an unconference: an open, inexpensive meeting where humanists and technologists of all skill levels learn and build together in sessions proposed on the spot.
Context: Small colleges take advantage of the networking and professional development opportunities of digital humanities centers at large institutions
Notes: THATCamp is no longer active.

Barebones project description: Generates high-quality metadata about novels published between 1660 and 1850 in order to make early works of fiction more available to both traditional and computational modes of humanistic study.
Context: Small colleges may also join collaborative, interinstitutional digital humanities projects supported by large research institutions.
Notes: Citation is a broken link.

Project Title: TEI Archiving, Preservation, and Access Service (TAPAS)
Discipline: Humanities, Social sciences, Linguistics, Digital Publishing
Barebones project description: Provides TEI-based projects a platform for organizing and publishing their encoded texts.
Grant supported?: NEH, Institute of Museum and Library Services, Digital Scholarship Group, TEI
Context: Aggregates expertise and labor of technology staff at small liberal arts colleges to help publish and archive high-quality scholarly data marked up according to TEI standards.

Creators: Corporation for Digital Scholarship, previously Center for History and New Media at George Mason University
Institution: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Barebones project description: A free and open-source reference management software to manage bibliographic data and related research materials.
Context: Example of open source tool.

Institution: Harvard University, College of the Holy Cross, Furman University, and the University of Houston
Barebones project description: Seeks to present the Homeric Iliad and Odyssey in a critical framework that accounts for the fact that these poems were composed orally over the course of hundreds, if not thousands of years by countless singers who composed in performance.
Context: Example of student-faculty collaborative research in digital humanities.

Project Title: Mooring Gaps: Marianne Moore’s Bryn Mawr Poetry
Barebones project description: A Bryn Mawr College senior English thesis in the form of a website.
A Web-based map and data sorting application that empowers parents to navigate and compare the growing number of public school options in metropolitan Hartford.
Context: For liberal arts colleges, applied learning has further benefits when it moves into the local community.
Notes: To replace SmartChoices, we created the School Search Tool template, a generic mobile-friendly interactive map with sortable results https://github.com/JackDougherty/school-search-tool

Author: Stephen Brier
Barebones project description: The world's most comprehensive index of full-text books.

Barebones project description: Creates print, visual, online, and digital materials that explore the diverse social and cultural histories of the nation and challenge traditional ways that people learn about the past.

Barebones project description: An online professional learning program designed to help middle and high school history teachers incorporate disciplinary literacy practices, rich social history content, and literacy supports into their instructional design.
Grant supported?: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, HASTAC, MacArthur Foudnation, Mozilla,m UCHRI
Context: Accomplishment of American Social History Project (ASHP).

Barebones project description: Explores the origins of contemporary philosophy by looking at historical relationships between individuals, institutions, and ideas. These relationships are contained in a user-maintained database and rendered using data visualization tools.
Context: Digital humanities projects by CUNY faculty and doctoral students at the New Media Lab.
Notes: Citation is a broken link.

Barebones project description: An online journal that showcases the ways contemporary poetry overcomes the limitations of the written text.
Context: Digital humanities projects by CUNY faculty and doctoral students at the New Media Lab.

Institution: New York City College of Technology (CUNY), New York University, University of Mary Washington, Rutgers University-Camden.
Barebones project description: A collaborative online space in which students research Whitman’s connections to their individual locations and share that research with one another in a dynamic, social, web-based learning environment.
Grant supported?: NEH, Institute of Museum and Library Services
Context: Example of a recent CUNY digital humanities project that combines digital research and digital pedagogy.

Barebones project description: An open space where the CUNY community can find like-minded colleagues, build personal or professional websites, teach, learn, and collaborate in open classrooms.
Context: Example of a recent CUNY digital humanities project that combines digital research and digital pedagogy.

Barebones project description: Helps you build any kind of community website using WordPress, with member profiles, activity streams, user groups, messaging, and more.

Chapter: Blog Post: The Public Course Blog: The Required Reading We Write Ourselves for the Course That Never Ends
Author: Trevor Owens
Barebones project description: he blog for a series of courses in digital curation and digital history. Currently, it hosts a course on digital preservation. It has previously hosted courses on digital art curation, digital preservation, digital history, and digital public history.
Context: The potential value that can come from new students in new iterations of the course “inhabiting” the same course blog in the future.

Chapter: Chapter 23: Digital Humanities As/Is a Tactical Term
Author: Matthew Kirschenbaum
Barebones project description: Founded in 2008, HathiTrust is a not-for-profit collaborative of academic and research libraries preserving 17+ million digitized items.
Context: Desire to do work with these remarkable materials under digital humanities.

Chapter: Chapter 27: Trending: The Promises and the Challenges of Big Social Data
Author: Lev Manovich
Institution: CUNY Graduate Center, University of California, San Diego (UCSD)
Discipline: Digital Tool, Data Visualization, Digital Humanities
Barebones project description: A research lab and a design studio working on analysis of big cultural datasets. Our work combines methods and technologies from data science, data visualization, media design and humanities. The products include data visualizations, interactive installations, free software tools and research papers and books.
Context: Examples of author's experience working with large cultural data sets.
Notes: Link to new site not active: http://www.culturalanalytics.info/

Barebones project description: Several mobile data sets that contain the dynamics of several communities of about 100 people each.
Context: Example of social data.

Barebones project description: An innovative, noninvasive archaeological survey of Mongolia’s sacred lands that allows web users around the world to actively participate in an ongoing, real-time scientific exploration.
Context: Examples of new techniques that combine on-the-scene physical presence and computer and network-assisted techniques.

Barebones project description: An online search engine that charts the frequencies of any set of search strings using a yearly count of n-grams found in sources printed between 1500 and 2019 in Google's text corpora in English, Chinese, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Russian, or Spanish.
Context: What you can do with these tools today is quite limited.

Chapter: Chapter 28: Humanities 2.0: Promise, Perils, Predictions
Author: Cathy N. Davidson
Barebones project description: A practical experiment in which we explore possibilities and challenges of digital collections in a networked world. Our flagship collection, under development since 1987, covers the history, literature and culture of the Greco-Roman world.
Grant supported?: Funded most recently by the Alpheios Project, the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, the Institute of Museum and Library Services, the National Endowment for the Humanities, the National Science Foundation, private donations, and Tufts University. Prior support for the project has been provided by the Annenberg/CPB Project, Apple Computer, the Berger Family Technology Transfer Endowment, Digital Libraries Initiative Phase 2, the Fund for the Improvement of Postsecondary Education part of the U.S. Department of Education, the Getty Grant program, the Modern Language Association, the National Endowment for the Arts, the Packard Humanities Institute, Xerox Corporation, Boston University, and Harvard University.
Context: Example of rich, diverse, and compelling digital resources.

Barebones project description: Analyzing and commenting on the Digital Revolution since 1979. Since 1996, we have been developing projects, strategies and competencies for the Digital Transformation.
Context: Example of rich, diverse, and compelling digital resources.

Barebones project description: International collaboration to make information and images of all manuscripts, paintings, textiles and artefacts from Dunhuang and archaeological sites of the Eastern Silk Road freely available on the Internet and to encourage their use through educational and research programmes.
Context: Challenges accepted definitions in the humanities, such as what constitutes and is constituted by the West.

Project Title: Networked Infrastructure for Nineteenth-Century Electronic Scholarship (NINES)
Barebones project description: A scholarly organization devoted to forging links between the material archive of the nineteenth century and the digital research environment of the twenty-first
Context: Augmenting professional, refereed, peer-reviewed archives with features that allow individual users to customize the archive.

Project Title: The Law in Slavery and Freedom

Barebones project description: An online search engine that charts the frequencies of any set of search strings using a yearly count of n-grams found in sources printed between 1500 and 2019 in Google's text corpora in English, Chinese, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Russian, or Spanish.
